intro: Nemesia karasbergensis, commonly known as Karasberg nemesia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of small, brightly colored flowers that range from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows as an annual or biennial herb, often reaching heights of 10 to 30 centimeters. Its foliage consists of ovate to lance-shaped leaves that are generally hairy and arranged oppositely along the stem. Nemesia karasbergensis is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
